Thank you Frank because if i had said the same as=C2=A0you..it would have n=
ot come as nice...sometimes I get emotionally about my passion for things..=
so Thank you for pointing out what you did

--- On Sat, 12/18/10, Frank Sum=
ption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:


From: Frank Sumption <purplealie=
ngirl@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: ok so im getting stuff on the s=
pectergram
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday, December 18, 2010, 1=
:24 PM


=C2=A0 




=C2=A0I think it's unrealistic to expect every file to=
 have faces and images. These faces are often just portions, eyes and lips,=
 some have eye brows. Like all of this, not done for proof, it's for emotio=
nal impact.=C2=A0 I have this woman that shows up in towels, always just ha=
lf the face. Perahps you are being too critical? As with all spirit message=
s, it's what it means to the experiencer that matters. Expecting full faces=
 is like expecting the kings english and proper grammer in all EVPs. 
=C2=
=A0
F-S


On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 3:07 AM, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@gmail=
.com> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I saw a couple which could be construed as images=
 in the one series you had from SEA, but nothing that knocked me over the h=
ead yet. =C2=A0I am going to have to see a larger sample size before I dete=
rmine if what you have witnessed is in fact a form or not. =C2=A0I cannot a=
ccept an image as paranormal without knowing where it sits among the bulk o=
f audio files. =C2=A0If every file has multiple faces, the I would have =C2=
=A0to say that there is nothing there. 


So, I will certainly keep testing=
 with my copy and hopefully something will really pop for me. =C2=A0I have =
run through about ten files (EVP and GBC) so far for intensive study and I =
still haven't got anything that I would consider a positive hit. =C2=A0I ne=
ed an actual formed face, not portions thereof, to consider an image real. =
=C2=A0This is the only way to discount visual matrixing.


I have high hope=
s for this though!


Tim

n <kalinu@...> wrote:

??

On Sa=
t, Dec 18, 2010 at 1:00 AM, psi_research <vilhellm@...> wrote:


=
=C2=A0 



I've seen live webcast of ITC sessions where GB output is fed di=
rectly into the mic line in on a computer running Adobe Audition with the s=
pectragraph running. It was really compelling to see letters and numbers, n=
ot images or pictures, but partial words appear in the graph. At first it w=
as I thought it was a software glitch but it is a repeatable event. It was =
on LiveSciFi which is run by Tim Wood, he also thought there was some kind =
of code error but it happened on more than one webcast. 

So if anyone has =
Audition, just feed Box output right in your computer and see what happens.=
 I wanted to try it tonight but I have Audacity and the spectragraph featur=
e doesn't have that shaded appearance that Audition does so it's not able t=
o render images or characters, at least as far as I see using the various s=
ettings.


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> =
wrote:
>
> I have tried numerous EVP files and short box clips and so far
>=
 nothing discernible has appeared on either program. I still have a lot of
=

> 
> I don't know about you guys, but I am going to try to w=
ork this in to a
> session tonight!
> 
> Tim

ode error but it happened on more than one webcast. <BR><BR>So if anyone ha=

ure doesn't have that shaded appearance that Audition does so it's not able=

 settings.</DIV>
